item.title: Aggregator 2.21
item.description: Added RTL support in the embedded entry viewer, based on the feed's language. In case a feed doesn't declare the correct language, the user can change it in the feed preferences.

item.title: Aggregator 2.20
item.description: Added support for feed compression and delta updates.

item.title: Aggregator 2.19
item.description:
New feature for Android 6+: Provide shortcut to customize the battery optimizations in the settings.

Added new setting to enable or disable the use of "Custom Tabs".

Fixed the feed links when they start with //

item.title: Aggregator 2.18
item.description:
New feature: "Add a subscription" directly from the browser or other apps that can share URLs.

Aggregator updates correctly now the published date of a changed entry. With this fix the support for feeds without publish dates has been also improved.

Fixed the animation of the entry list.

item.title: Translating Aggregator
item.description:
Looking at Google's statistic, I thought that there might be some users out there that would like to contribute by translating the app. So I set up a website that would allow just that.

In the past days I looked at more self-hostable solutions and decided to go on with Weblate. In this post I am not going to explain how to use Weblate since this is alreay covered by their documentation , but go briefly over what means to translate Aggregator.

Authentication

Registration is open. You only need a Google account to be able to sign in.

This account will be used for e-mail notifications, if enabled.

Initial configuration

On your first login, please go to the profile page and set the Full name. The username and the full name is the only information visible to other translators. You can configure both of them.

Next, please go to Languages and select your language(s) in the Translated languages field.

Now move to Subscriptions and select Aggregator as a watched project.

By completing these two steps, the Weblate dashboard will give you direct links to the languages you can translate.

To stay informed about new strings to translate, new suggestions or new comments activate them in the subscription settings (this section is not visible in the mobile version of the website).

The translation process

Translators are able to suggest new translations or vote suggestions from other translators. A suggestion is applied as soon as it receives 3 votes.

If some strings cannot be translated just by looking at the string and context, please add a comment and I'll try to give more details.

Strings can contain special markers like %1$s or %2$d. Please keep them in the translated text. They are required at runtime when the final text is generated.

Only the languages that are over 90% completed are added to Aggregator. Gowing below this percentage means removal too.

Currently, there are 164 strings (totaling 433 words) used in different parts of the app. Not that many... Right?

item.title: Aggregator 2.17
item.description:
Swipe to refresh works now at both the top and the bottom of the list. The same action now hides the read entries too.

The title of pinned entries has a more prominent color to be noticed more easily.

All layouts have been updated to support RTL languages... and I prepared a website for the ones interested in translating the app in their language. Drop me an e-mail if you want to help...

item.title: Aggregator 2.16
item.description:
More material design

The mark all as read action has been converted to a floating action button, and its place has been taken by the refresh action.

To give a better idea what happens in the background, the refresh action shows now how many feeds are beeing syncronized...

Clicking the refresh action, while spinning, will display more details.

item.title: Aggregator 2.15
item.description:
Entry list

The entry list has received a facelift that dims down the noise produced by high-contrasted colors and allows the reader to focus more on the content.

Unread entries now appear in bold while read entries are grayed out. Feeds annotated with a color have a colored bullet in front of the entry time.

OPML

The feeds import and export activities display now the feed categories in a similar way to the entry list...

item.title: Aggregator 2.14
item.description:
In the past weeks I received a lot of emails with questions on how the entry rules work...

Even though this feed already provides an howto related to this topic, the majority of users doesn't use it (some users forgot about it while others lost access to it by unsubscribing from this feed).

Starting with this release, the same howto is now available right from the create entry rule activity...

item.title: Aggregator 2.13.5
item.description:
Unfortunately, the Google Feed API service has been discontinued on 15 December 2016.

As a result, the find feeds by keywords feature has stopped functionning... and with this release I removed it entirely.

If you are aware of another free service that provides a similar functionality, drop me an email...

item.title: Aggregator 2.13
item.description:
What's new?

  • Android 5+ only: Aggregator takes advantage of the new JobScheduler API, to become more battery friendly
  • The displayed time respects now the user's time settings
  • When available, the author of an entry is displayed in entry lists and the embedded viewer

item.title: Aggregator 2.12
item.description:
The update history is back!

When I started working on the new design of the update history I had these goals:

  • make it scrollable to cover a longer period of time
  • include visual hints for the time passed between updates
  • provide extended details for each update

To access the update history, navigate to a feed and select the Update history option from the overflow menu. If Aggregator failed to update the feed, the Update history option is available directly in the action bar.

Also, in the navigation drawer, feeds that failed to be updated are now highlighted.

Redirects

Starting with this version, Aggregator will handle both temporary and permanent redirects.

item.title: Aggregator 2.11
item.description:
What's new?

  • You can directly open the original article with the browser by pressing entry's feed icon in the entries list.
  • Long pressing the entry's feed icon, navigates you to that feed.

item.title: Aggregator 2.10
item.description:
What's new?

  • Renamed the Unread category to All, and added the option to show the read entries
  • The Show read entries is now permanent
  • Increased the entry list font size

item.title: Aggregator 2.9
item.description:
What's new?

  • Pull to refresh! Works on every entry list (unread, category or feed)
  • The update scheduler groups now feeds in slots of 15 minutes, for better battery life
  • D-Pad navigation support
  • Fixed the global entry rules

item.title: Aggregator 2.8
item.description:
What's new?

  • Full support for the Android 6.0 permission model
  • The exported OPML file includes now the entry rules too
  • Support for media description (present in feeds from Youtube)
  • The feed category is now displayed for each feed entry

item.title: Aggregator 2.7
item.description:
Aggregator 2.7 brings support for user-defined feed categories.

Collapsing or expanding a category can be done by long-pressing it.

To a assign a feed to a category one has to go to the feed preference activity, also accessible via a long-press.

Other changes:

  • light and dark themes for the entire app
  • fix for duplicate entries
  • fix for repeated notification sound and vibrations

item.title: Aggregator Howto » Entry Rules
item.description:
Aggregator uses user-defined entry rules to filter out the entries of a feed.

There are two types of rules: exclude rules, used to mark which entries should be hidden while aggregating a feed, and include rules, used to cancel the effect of some exclude rules.

Every entry rule defines a mask used to match the entries for which the rule action is applied. The % character is used to match zero, one or multiple characters, and can be used multiple times in a mask.

For example, the %aggregator% title mask will match every entry that contains aggregator in the title. While the % Vol % Ch % title mask will match every entry that contains both Vol and Ch (in the same order as present in the mask) in the title.

Excluding unwished entries

The easiest way to define rules that hide entries of a feed is by using the exclude action:

  1. Select the entry which you want to exclude by long pressing it.
  2. Click the exclude action from the action bar.

NOTE: Depending on your device type, the exclude action can be found either as as an action icon or as an option in the overflow menu.

HINT: Long pressing an icon in the action bar reveals the action name.

Excluding all entries except the whished ones

This is achieved by defining at least two rules:

  1. An exclude rule that hides every entry by using the following title mask: %
  2. One or more include rules that will cancel the effect of the exclude rule.

These rules are preferably created from the entry rules activity, which can be opened by clicking the entry rules option from the overflow menu.

NOTE: The entry rules activity lists all the rules of a feed, including the global ones, while also showing how many entries are matched by a rule.

item.title: Aggregator 2.6
item.description:
Aggregator is not dead... development is just (very) slow.

So what's new?

  • redesigned UI
  • exclude and include rules for feed entries
  • entry reader with new "show original" option
  • feed:// support
  • pinned entries: which are shown are unread until manually marked as read
